Package gameobject

Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameobject.GameObject
      • gameobject.Animal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlueFish, Crab, GoldFish, GreenFish, PufferFish, PurpleFish, RedFish, ZappyBoi

    public abstract class Animal
extends GameObject
    Animal is an abstract GameObject for all fish represented in our game.
    Author:
    W Mathieu Mimms-Boyce, Miguel Fuentes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal​(int xPos,
              int yPos,
              int depth,
              int xSize,
              int ySize)
        Constructor for the Animal class, which is used by each subclass

        All parameters not set by this constructer will be set in the constructor for each specific animal.

        See Also:
        This constructor sets everything the parent class does., More specific debugging constructor

    • Method Detail

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition​()
        updatePositon is used to have fish move along their pathfinding. This should be called in the update method of each fish.

      • getQuestion

        public Question getQuestion​()
        Returns:
        The Question object of the fish.

        question - Changes the Question object of the fish.

        public int getSpeed​()
        Returns:
        The speed of the fish.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed​(int speed)
        Parameters:
        speed - How fast the fish will be set to.

      • getPathLength

        public int getPathLength​()
        Returns:
        The path length of the fish. This is how long the path is.

      • getPathState

        public int getPathState​()
        Returns:
        The pathState of the fish. This is how far along the path the fish is.

      • setPathState

        public void setPathState​(int pathState)
        Parameters:
        pathState - What the pathState is going to be set to.

      • setPathLength

        public void setPathLength​(int pathLength)
        Parameters:
        pathLength - What the pathLength is going to be set to.

      • isMovingForward

        public boolean isMovingForward​()
        Returns:
        Whether the fish is moving forward along its path or not.

      • setMovingForward

        public void setMovingForward​(boolean movingForward)
        Parameters:
        movingForward - The moving status we want to set the fish to.

      • setAvgSize

        public void setAvgSize​(double AvgSize)
        Parameters:
        AvgSize - The size (in feet) the fish will be set to.

      • getAvgSize

        public double getAvgSize​()
        Returns:
        The average size of the fish (in feet)

      • setRealPic

        public void setRealPic​(java.lang.String imagePath)

        imagePath - The photo of the fish to be displayed in the notead.

      • getRealPic

        public java.lang.String getRealPic​()
